messages: 2a07ebd9ed08858687b3d848b7b1d65d (15:42): i wanted to know how to run httpd and tomcat side by side
2a07ebd9ed08858687b3d848b7b1d65d (15:43): tomcat is set with virtualhosts currently
2a07ebd9ed08858687b3d848b7b1d65d (15:43): but it catches all requests and httpd requires i use another port in that case
2a07ebd9ed08858687b3d848b7b1d65d (15:45): you saved me from typing more.
55e4fcc2e6db25f25a108eb2c97b0149 (15:48): which httpd you want to use?
21a7f2441136ed2d9c0609c95504dad4 (15:50): im using tomcat 5.5 and got a servlet, which loads ~400MB into a static HashMap
21a7f2441136ed2d9c0609c95504dad4 (15:50): after reloading the servlet in the manager panel
21a7f2441136ed2d9c0609c95504dad4 (15:51): does anyone know about a way to clean this up during reload?
2a07ebd9ed08858687b3d848b7b1d65d (15:51): jasonb had mentioned he was working on a java based subversion repo... (i think he's on sabbatical tho)
55e4fcc2e6db25f25a108eb2c97b0149 (15:52): use apache for getting the requests and to delegate them to tomcat if needed
2a07ebd9ed08858687b3d848b7b1d65d (15:52): harpoon: i wanted to do the opposite
2a07ebd9ed08858687b3d848b7b1d65d (15:52): use tomcat to delegate the svn request
55e4fcc2e6db25f25a108eb2c97b0149 (15:52): or run them on different ports
2a07ebd9ed08858687b3d848b7b1d65d (15:53): problem is with different ports all the domains are on the same ip
55e4fcc2e6db25f25a108eb2c97b0149 (15:53): a third possibility would be, not using webdav
55e4fcc2e6db25f25a108eb2c97b0149 (15:53): but start subversion in deamon mode
2a07ebd9ed08858687b3d848b7b1d65d (15:54): the daemon i mean; catch the domain name
55e4fcc2e6db25f25a108eb2c97b0149 (15:55): i use svn+ssh for connecting the repository
2a07ebd9ed08858687b3d848b7b1d65d (16:02): i think i'll end up doing the same harpoon
